Author: rms
Title: IBM torpedo about web-enhanced health care

Author: rms
Title: Health Care in California
Content:
I'm looking for health coverage for a company in California.\nplusbryan likes Kaiser because they do things online and their doctors answer emails: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=74555

However, negative things were said about Kaiser in this thread: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30326 Is Kaiser better/less evil than other HMOs? Does anyone else have doctors that answer emails? I would like someone that has more options in plans than Tonik.

Is there anyone like this web-enhanced, housecall only, doesn't take insurance doctor in the Bay Area? http://www.jayparkinsonmd.com/

Author: fauigerzigerk
Content: No, the information comes from the companies' websites, from wikipedia, magazine articles and so forth. I'm sure not everything is correct. Sometimes it's very ambiguous who exactly is considered a founder and who's not. It's only a rough picture.

Author: mxh
Content:
Interesting .... one corner-case I see has to do with mouseover. For instance, some sites (http://www.newegg.com) use JS to dynamically expand/contract menus based on mouse travel. I don't think a simple ImageMap would hack it in that case. Do you have a workaround in mind?

(Granted, sites are typically built to not _depend_ on this sort of fancy JS.)\n
